body.value: The angle: Columbia’s low fundraising for financial aid, focus on expanding student services, and dependence on CC/SEAS tuition revenue amid huge losses in budget puts socioeconomic diversity at risk because financial aid funds down + admitting wealthy students will be a crucial part of financial health of A&S
I. Provide quick necessary info on need-blind admissions at Columbia
II. Present problem--COVID-19 causing recession, worse than 2009, less revenue/more students will need aid.
III. Structure makes it so that Columbia lags behind in fundraising, Columbia less dependent on endowmnet than other ivies, depends on CC and SEAS tuition for most of A&S budget

IV. “Amenities arms race”/Core to Commencement, risky bank deals to fund expansion of student services to justify hiking tuition, has now created a situation where university able to funnel in more cash via wealthy students but also creates greater burden of financial aid to cover low and middle income students’ high financial need
V. What happened in 2009 and why this is much worse than that, why tuition dollars will be even more important than before
VI. They’ll do it via Algorithm re: “But I thought admissions and finances weren’t even in the same area?”
